General Information.name: Robin Bretin
General Information.label: PhD, HCI/HRI Researcher, Cognitive Engineer
General Information.summary: A French-born, curiosity-driven individual whose nature led them to become a researcher.

Experiences.name: University of Glasgow, Glasgow, United Kingdom
Experiences.summary: Performed various research activities throughout my thesis.
highlights: - Designed and conducted in-person and VR-based user studies, employing Unity, C#, and Python drone programming.
- Quantitative and qualitative analysis of various data format, academic reporting of the results (e.g., posters, journal and conference papers).
- Presented published work at international conferences, including CHI and INTERACT.
- Reviewed papers for CHI, HRI, CSCW, THRI, and ISMAR.
- Served as 1AC for CHI LBW track.

Experiences.name: Chalmers University of Technology, Goteborg, Sweden
Experiences.summary: Led a project on Drones' social cues impact on proxemics, in collaboration with local researchers including Mohammad Obaid.

Experiences.name: SNCF/Human Design Group, Paris, France
Experiences.summary: Developed a methodology to assess human reliability in train conductor functions for the Autonomous Train project.
highlights: Collaborated with train conductors and presented findings to clients.

Experiences.name: Armed Forces Biomedical Research Institute (IRBA), Brétigny-sur-Orge, France
Experiences.summary: Conducted ergonomic inspections of the VICTEAMS VR prototype.
highlights: Investigated gaze-based interaction designs and collected data in VR environments.
Contributed to improving virtual environments for team-based training scenarios.

education.institution: University of Glasgow, Glasgow, United Kingdom
education.summary: Thesis titled 'Beyond Boundaries: Unveiling Human-Drone Proxemic Dynamics Using Virtual Reality.'

education.institution: École Nationale Supérieure de Cognitique (ENSC), Bordeaux, France
education.summary: Specialized in applied cognitive psychology to technology usage (cognitive engineering), with training in human factors, programming, artificial intelligence, and human-computer interaction.
Lectures on Big Data, Game Design and 3D modeling during a culturally enriching exchange program.

education.institution: La Prépa des INP, Grenoble, France
education.summary: Intensive foundational studies preparing for competitive entrance exams to French Grandes Écoles.

education.institution: Lycée Notre-Dame du Roc, La Roche-sur-Yon, France
education.area: Exact Sciences - Life and Earth Sciences (S-SVT)
education.summary: Graduated with highest honors (Mention Très Bien).

awards.title: IFIP TC13 Pioneers' Award for Best Doctoral Student Paper
awards.summary: Recognized for exceptional contribution to doctoral research in Human-Computer Interaction.

references.name: Dr. Mohamed Khamis
